paper_metadata.title: Building Pathways Out of Poverty for Ultra-poor IDPs and Vulnerable Host Communities in Baidoa

program_information.program_name: Building Pathways Out of Poverty Ultra-poor Graduation (UPG) Program
program_information.target_population: Ultra-poor internally displaced households and vulnerable host communities

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: The UPG intervention includes an initial phase of unconditional cash transfers disbursed over a nine-month period to stabilize ultra-poor households' food security.

component_b_assets.assets_evidence_citation: Income-generating capacity was supported through vocational and financial training and the transfer of start-up kits.

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: the treatment effect on poverty reduction (a decline of 25 percentage points) is notably large relative to existing estimates
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: This brief reports on endline findings from a randomized controlled trial (RCT) evaluating the project

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: This brief reports on endline findings from a randomized controlled trial (RCT) evaluating the project Building Pathways Out of Poverty for Ultra-poor IDPs and Vulnerable Host Communities in Baidoa, an ultra-poor graduation (UPG) intervention
evidence_citations.country_citation: Somalia is one of the poorest countries in the world, and severe poverty, ongoing armed conflict, and recurring droughts and floods have created a humanitarian crisis characterized by a high level of internal displacement. Baidoa city-the site of this evaluation
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: The project seeks to enable ultra-poor internally displaced households to graduate from extreme poverty and begin the upward trajectory to self-reliance for displacement-affected communities
